comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Elise Kutscherra DeNys, Belgian operatic soprano based in Paris, specialized in Wagner parts--the surname Kutschera is sometimes spelled with only one R (I'm finding it both ways, in news sources and other places).  She's mentioned in a 12 November 1914 New York Times brief article, tracking down impresario Rudolf Aronson after their correspondence was disrupted by the war.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I found victor.library.ucsb.edu/index.php/talent/detail/5136/De_N... and "Kutscherra, Elise: Soprano ( ): Paris Opéra debut 15 Jun 1896 as Sieglinde in la Walkyrie." in www.historicopera.com/listing_singers_k.htm

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started an entry for her in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elise_Kutscherra_DeNys The image is dated November 13, 1914. She arrived on November 9, 1914 in New York City so this image must be from her return trip. Name:Elise Kutscherra Arrival Date:9 Nov 1914 Birth Year:abt 1872 Birth Location:Austria Birth Location Other:Prague Age:42 Gender:Female Ethnicity/Race­/Nationality:Belgian Port of Departure:Le Havre Port of Arrival:New York, New York Ship Name:Rochambeau I have the image of her manifest. Here is an interview with her in the New York Times after the 1914 concert: select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F70E17F63E5B1773...

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to all of you for finding such great information about Mme. Kutscherra.  We'll add some of it and the date to the record the next time we update.
